channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

Report X-2024030703

  • City: ROGERS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030703 SequenceEvent: Package was called out as requiring additional processing, package was discovered to have been repackaged at another station. upon inspection, package handler stated it was overturned, causing the vented cap to release contents DescribePack: Vented cap released due to overturned package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the QA Damaged Hazmat area X-2024030704 SequenceEvent: Package was called out as requiring additional processing, package was discovered to have been repackaged at another station. upon inspection, package handler stated it was overturned, causing the vented cap to release contents DescribePack: Vented cap released due to overturned package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the QA Damaged Hazmat area

item.title: Report X-2024030615
item.description:
Report X-2024030615

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A LARGE STYROFOAM BOX BROKE OPEN ON ONE SIDE CAUSING DRY ICE TO FALL OUT FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED LESS THAN FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A FIVE GALLON PAIL OF PINEAPPLE JUICE CONCENTRATE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024030330
item.description:
Report E-2024030330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Union Pacific Railroad delivered TILX 202905 to the Minnesota Commercial Railway. During the inbound inspection, it was found that the car had some product coming out of the top when sloshing. No product was hitting the ground. The MNNR refused interchange on the railcar and notified the Union Pacific Railroad of the discovery. The Union Pacific hired Rybak Environmental Inc. to look at the car and clean up the side of the car. Upon inspection by Rybak, it was discovered that the car was missing a manhole gasket.
